param.name: dimensionless
param.note: if true: input parameters hereunder are non-dimensional

param.name: rayleigh
param.note: used ONLY if dimensionless; Computed otherwise

param.name: alpha
param.note: in K^-1. Not used if dimensionless

param.name: kappa
param.note: in m^2/s. Not used if dimensionless

param.name: k
param.note: in W/(m.K). Not used if dimensionless

param.name: rho
param.note: in kg/m^3. Not used if dimensionless

param.name: g
param.note: in m/s^2. Not used if dimensionless

param.name: D
param.note: in meters. Not used if dimensionless

param.name: Ttop
param.note: in K. Not used if dimensionless

param.name: Tbot
param.note: in K. Not used if dimensionless

param.name: eta_ref
param.note: in Pa.s. Not used if dimensionless

param.name: T_ref
param.note: in K. Not used if dimensionless. WARNING: the viscosity at the bottom (for the Rayleigh) is computed so that eta=eta_ref for T=T_ref. If eta_ref is the viscosity at the bottom, make sure that T_ref=Tbot

param.name: ToffAdim
param.note: used ONLY if dimensionless; computed otherwise

param.name: ToffDim
param.note: not used if dimensionless. WARNING: Should be 0.0 for real Arrhenius law.

param.name: viscosity
param.note: can be: Arrhenius or FK

param.name: Ea
param.note: can be dimensionless, or in kJ/mol if NOT dimensionless

param.name: theta
param.note: only used if viscosity=FK, always taken as dimensionless

param.name: coeffTi
param.note: recommended value for 2-D cartesian: 0.714

param.name: coeffNu
param.note: recommended value for 2-D cartesian: 0.485

param.name: precision
param.note: defines the dimensionless precision for the temperature in the numerical solution

param.name: error
param.note: accepted relative error in Newton's method

param.name: Tcmin
param.note: recommended value=0.2; can be higher for very high viscosity contrasts
